metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: XSLT - Transformation
Example study: How to transform XML into XHTML using XSLT?
content.html: Example study: How to transform XML into XHTML using XSLT?

content.text: The details of this example will be explained in the next chapter.
content.html: The details of this example will be explained in the next chapter.

content.text: Correct Style Sheet Declaration
The root element that declares the document to be an XSL style sheet is <xsl:stylesheet> or <xsl:transform>.
content.html: The root element that declares the document to be an XSL style sheet is <xsl:stylesheet> or <xsl:transform>.

content.text: Note: <xsl:stylesheet> and <xsl:transform> are completely synonymous and either can be used!
content.html: Note: <xsl:stylesheet> and <xsl:transform> are completely synonymous and either can be used!

content.text: The correct way to declare an XSL style sheet according to the W3C XSLT Recommendation is:
content.html: The correct way to declare an XSL style sheet according to the W3C XSLT Recommendation is:

content.code_html:
<xsl:stylesheet version="1.0"
xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform">

content.text: or:

content.code_html:
<xsl:transform version="1.0"
xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform">

content.text: To get access to the XSLT elements, attributes and features we must declare the XSLT namespace at the top of the document.
content.html: To get access to the XSLT elements, attributes and features we must declare the XSLT namespace at the top of the document.

content.text: The xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" points to the official W3C XSLT namespace. If you use this namespace, you must also include the attribute version="1.0".
content.html: The xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" points to the official W3C XSLT namespace. If you use this namespace, you must also include the attribute version="1.0".

content.text: Start with a Raw XML Document
We want to transform the following XML document ("cdcatalog.xml") into XHTML:
content.html: We want to transform the following XML document ("cdcatalog.xml") into XHTML:

content.code_html:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<catalog>
  <cd>
    <title>Empire Burlesque</title>
    <artist>Bob Dylan</artist>
    <country>USA</country>
    <company>Columbia</company>
    <price>10.90</price>
    <year>1985</year>
  </cd>
.
.
</catalog>

content.text: Viewing XML Files in browsers: Open the XML file (click on the link below) - The XML document will be displayed with color-coded root and child elements. Often, there is an arrow or plus/minus sign to the left of the elements that can be clicked to expand or collapse the element structure. Tip: To view the raw XML source, right-click in XML file and select "View Page Source"!
content.html: Viewing XML Files in browsers: Open the XML file (click on the link below) - The XML document will be displayed with color-coded root and child elements. Often, there is an arrow or plus/minus sign to the left of the elements that can be clicked to expand or collapse the element structure. Tip: To view the raw XML source, right-click in XML file and select "View Page Source"!

content.text: View "cdcatalog.xml"
Create an XSL Style Sheet
Then you create an XSL Style Sheet ("cdcatalog.xsl") with a transformation template:
content.html: Then you create an XSL Style Sheet ("cdcatalog.xsl") with a transformation template:

content.code:
My CD Collection

Title Artist
content.code_html:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<xsl:stylesheet version="1.0"
xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform">

<xsl:template match="/">
  <html>
  <body>
  <h2>My CD Collection</h2>
  <table border="1">
    <tr bgcolor="#9acd32">
      <th>Title</th>
      <th>Artist</th>
    </tr>
    <xsl:for-each select="catalog/cd">
    <tr>
      <td><xsl:value-of select="title"/></td>
      <td><xsl:value-of select="artist"/></td>
    </tr>
    </xsl:for-each>
  </table>
  </body>
  </html>
</xsl:template>

</xsl:stylesheet>

content.text: View "cdcatalog.xsl"
Link the XSL Style Sheet to the XML Document
Add the XSL style sheet reference to your XML document ("cdcatalog.xml"):
content.html: Add the XSL style sheet reference to your XML document ("cdcatalog.xml"):

content.code:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="cdcatalog.xsl"?>

<catalog>


<cd>


<title>Empire Burlesque</title>


<artist>Bob Dylan</artist>


<country>USA</country>


<company>Columbia</company>


<price>10.90</price>


<year>1985</year>


</cd>

.

.

</catalog>
content.code_html:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="cdcatalog.xsl"?>
<catalog>
  <cd>
    <title>Empire Burlesque</title>
    <artist>Bob Dylan</artist>
    <country>USA</country>
    <company>Columbia</company>
    <price>10.90</price>
    <year>1985</year>
  </cd>
.
.
</catalog>

content.text: If you have an XSLT compliant browser it will nicely transform your XML into XHTML.
content.html: If you have an XSLT compliant browser it will nicely transform your XML into XHTML.

content.text: View the result
The details of the example above will be explained in the next chapters.
content.html: The details of the example above will be explained in the next chapters.
